Job Position: Logistic &amp; Office Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Onipan, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Logistics and Office Manager is responsible for overseeing the company&rsquo;s logistics operations, including rider management, while ensuring the smooth and efficient running of the office.
	This role ensures that riders are properly coordinated, office facilities are well maintained, and company assets are effectively managed and accounted for.


Key Responsibilities
Logistics &amp; Rider Management:


	Coordinate and manage daily logistics operations involving company riders.
	Schedule riders, assign routes, and monitor performance to ensure timely and efficient service delivery.
	Ensure riders comply with company policies, safety standards, and operational procedures.
	Track rider attendance, productivity, and resolve operational issues as they arise.
	Oversee maintenance, fueling, and proper use of delivery vehicles and bikes.


Office Management:


	Oversee day-to-day office operations to ensure a clean, safe, and well-organized work environment.
	Manage office supplies, utilities, vendors, and service providers.
	Ensure office facilities and equipment are properly maintained and promptly repaired when needed.
	Support administrative processes and ensure smooth coordination across departments.


Asset Management:


	Maintain an accurate inventory of all company assets, including bikes, equipment, furniture, and office tools.
	Ensure proper usage, storage, and accountability of company assets.
	Track asset allocation, movement, maintenance, and depreciation where applicable.
	Implement asset control procedures to prevent loss, misuse, or damage.


Compliance &amp; Reporting:


	Ensure compliance with company policies and relevant regulatory requirements.
	Prepare regular reports on logistics performance, asset status, and office operations.
	Identify process improvement opportunities to enhance efficiency and reduce costs.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Logistics, Supply Chain Management, or a related field (preferred).
	Proven experience in logistics, office management, or operations management.
	Experience managing riders, drivers, or field staff is an added advantage.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Excellent communication and people-management skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office or Google Workspace.
	Ability to work independently and solve problems proactively.


Key Competencies:


	Operational efficiency
	Attention to detail
	Asset control and accountability
	Time management
	Leadership and coordination


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;

title: Job Openings at Kartel
content:
Kartel is a brand of Skyville Company Limited, a leading manufacturer of Solar systems including Inverters, Solar Panels, Solar Charge Controllers, Solar batteries, etc. Kärtel products are recognized worldwide for their resilient quality and reliability for various domestic and commercial applications. One of the best solar solutions in Nigeria

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Driver

Job Locations: Abuja, Lagos, Ibadan - Oyo and Onitsha - Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Transport goodsand/or packages to and from destinations
	Arrive at destinations on schedule
	Fulfill administrative needs, like office pickups, site visitations
	Research and plan for traffic, construction and weather delays
	Use navigation applications to determine the best route
	Interact with clients professionally at all times
	Ensure that the vehicle is always fueled and ready for use
	Arrange for vehicle repairs as needed
	Keep mileage records and repair records up-to-date.


Application Closing Date: 24th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV to: careers@skyvillelimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Solar Technician 

Job Location: Abuja / Lagos / Ibadan - Oyo / Onitsha - Anambra
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Perform varying corrective, preventive, and emergency maintenance for solar PV systems.
	Interact with customers on a professional level as part of a multi-tasking team.
	Perform onsite installations, repairs, and troubleshooting.
	Check and provide complete documentation to clients.
	Carry out site root analysis.
	Attend the conference and B2B meetings to assess new solar system technologies as part of a team.
	Apply root cause analysis techniques on all major and recurring faults.
	Investigate technical failures and prepare formal technical reports.
	Record keeping and management of spare part movements.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 25th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV to: careers@skyvillelimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Business Development Executive

Job Location: Ikeja / Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs
	Actively seek out new sales opportunities through cold calling, networking and social media
	Set up meetings with potential clients and listen to their wishes and concerns
	Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services
	Create frequent reviews and reports with sales and financial data
	Ensure the availability of stock for sales and demonstrations
	Participate on behalf of the company in exhibitions or conferences
	Negotiate/close deals and handle complaints or objections
	Collaborate with team members to achieve better results
	Gather feedback from customers or prospects and share with internal teams


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess relevant qualifications.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 25th December, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV to: careers@skyvillelimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
